steps.name: intro
steps.prompt: Hello! My name’s Mark. What prompted you to seek help with your debts today?
steps.on_match_note: Acknowledge and move to name capture.

steps.name: name
steps.prompt: Great, I look forward to helping you to clear off your debts. Can you let me know who I’m speaking to?

steps.name: biggest_worry
steps.prompt: Just so I can point you in the right direction, what is your biggest worry about your debts?

steps.name: reassure
steps.prompt: Don’t worry, {name} — we’re going to help you with your debts today.

steps.name: regulatory_1
steps.prompt: I just need to make you aware that there is no obligation for you to act on the advice you receive today, and there are sources of free debt advice available at MoneyHelper (moneyhelper.org.uk). Shall we carry on?

steps.name: health
steps.prompt: Do you suffer with any health conditions that we should be aware of? If you do tell me, are you happy for us to save this information and share it with our trusted partners if necessary?

steps.name: changes
steps.prompt: Are you expecting any changes to your situation in the next 12 months (for example income, housing, family, health)?

steps.name: consolidation_value
steps.prompt: If we could help you consolidate your debts into one affordable payment, stop interest and charges, and possibly write off some debt — how much would that help you each month?

steps.name: invite_portal
steps.prompt: So that we can better understand your situation, I can set you up with your secure client portal. There you can add details, upload supporting documents and track progress. Shall I open it now?

steps.name: portal_guidance
steps.prompt: While you’re in the portal, I’ll stay here to guide you. You can come back to the chat any time with the button in the top right. Please follow the outstanding tasks so we can understand your situation. When you’ve saved your details, just say “done” and we’ll continue.

steps.name: documents
steps.prompt: Now that we have the basics, please upload what you can: proof of ID; last 3 months’ bank statements for each account; payslips (3 months or 12 weeks) if employed; last year’s tax return if self-employed; Universal Credit statements (12 months + latest full statement) if applicable; car finance docs if applicable; and any creditor letters or statements.

steps.name: wrap_up
steps.prompt: Brilliant — our assessment team will now review your case and come back with next steps. You can check progress in your portal any time. Is there anything else you’d like to ask before we wrap up?

ack: Hi there — I’m here to help.
Hello! Let’s work through this together.
Hey — we’ll keep this simple and supportive.

empathy.msg: I know bailiff contact is stressful — we’ll get protections in place quickly.
Court or default letters can be worrying — we’ll address that calmly.
Missed payments happen; we’ll focus on stabilising things now.
We’ll prioritise essentials like housing and utilities.
Thanks for being honest — this stays judgement-free and practical.
